trans-unit.source: Provides data about a change in value to a dependency property as reported by particular routed events, including the previous and current value of the property that changed.
This is a generic class where the class is used for event data of different events.
Different routed events can specify the type constraint of the generic to produce a type-specific event data class.

Once the class is constrained, the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs%601.OldValue%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs%601.NewValue%2A> properties also reflect these type constraints; thus you can use a common event data class for different property changed events without requiring different delegates for each possible property type.

Routed events that reports a property change where the delegate incorporates this event data class include <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.ValueChanged>, where the type constraint (and old and new values passed in the arguments) is of type <xref:System.Double>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged>, where the type constraint is <xref:System.Object>.
The type of the dependency property that has changed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs`1"></xref> class, with provided old and new values.
The types passed must match the declared constraints of the specific generic.
Previous value of the property, prior to the event being raised.
Current value of the property at the time of the event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs`1"></xref> class, with provided old and new values, and an event identifier.
The types passed for `oldValue` and `newValue` must match the declared constraints of the specific generic.
Previous value of the property, prior to the event being raised.
Current value of the property at the time of the event.
Identifier of the routed event that this arguments class carries information for.
Invokes event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase event system efficiency.
This implementation casts the generic handler as a <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventHandler%601> and then invokes it.

For details on this implementation pattern and the reasons for it, see <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A> and [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).
The generic handler to call in a type-specific way.
The target to call the handler on.
Gets the new value of a property as reported by a property changed event.
The value and type constraint of this property will be established by the constructor.
The generic value.

In a practical implementation of the <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs`1"></xref>, the generic type of this property is replaced with the constrained type of the implementation.
Gets the previous value of the property as reported by a property changed event.
The value and type constraint of this property will be established by the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs%601> constructor's type arguments.
The generic value.

In a practical implementation of the <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs`1"></xref>, the generic type of this property is replaced with the constrained type of the implementation.
